As soon as you arrive at the northern town, you find it attacked by monsters. As you rush forward to its defense, you wonder, “What secret does this well-defended town hold, that the monsters are willing to attack it, despite being outnumbered?”

User summary:

For 3rd level characters.

225143.description:
Description from the publisher:

Last fall, crackling fires wreathed the mountains. This spring, light-wielding thunderstorms roiled the valleys. Now, with summer come early and a glowing moon overhead, the soil is moist and black and delicious mushrooms are peeking up all over the forest. The Foray is on!

Morels Foray expands Morels with new items, characters, weather, a more dynamic forest, and unique systems enabling 2-4 players. 3p and 4p have slightly augmented decks, start players with a basket and sticks, and introduce "peek cards" placed beside the deck to show what's coming up in the forest (these cards enhance planning depth but are not immediately accessible).

Each player count also has unique facets. In 3p, players receive an optional (non-card acquisition) bonus action at the end of each turn. In 4p, a marker rotates clockwise to show who is the Priority Player on any given turn. Players select cards from the same forest simultaneously on a Compass, then reveal and resolve proceeding clockwise before resetting the forest and passing the Priority Marker. Deciphering playing styles and motives is helpful because having selected an option that is no longer available when you go to resolve requires altering your choice and incurs a penalty. This style of simultaneous play keeps a peppy pace with no down time and resembles a 2p Morels hallmark in evaluating what your opponents are likely to do and adjusting for optimal foraging.

At its heart, Morels Foray varies both the social and tactical texture of Morels. The new cards present fresh decisions and the opportunity for new strategies. Weather cards (Rainstorm and Forest Fire) can decimate existing forests or spring up new ones, Items (Map, Shiitake Log) grant power with proper timing, Events (Farmers Market, Eureka!) enable big plays, Characters (Thief, Farm Girl, Eccentric, Chef) allow you to interact with the forest and your opponent(s) in new ways, and new mushrooms (Lion's Mane, Panther Cap) expand your foraging options in the ever beckoning forest.
225143.name: Morels Foray

225144.name: Magic Hat
225144.description:
Description from the publisher:

Magic Hat is a colourful memory game for the whole family!

What is it about?

Something disturbing happened in the Magic Kingdom! At night someone swapped all the hats in the castle! The Wizard looks ridiculously funny wearing Dragon’s horns on his head. We need to help the citizens of the Magic Kingdom with this mess!

Wow! How do we play?

The object for each player is to return the hats to their owners as fast as possible strategically moving the cards, bluffing and trying to mislead the opponents.

When it’s your turn, you have the following options: look up one hat card, swap two hat cards, open the matching hat card for the character.

If you open the wrong card you will have to take a penalty token and wait until your next turn to try and get that magic hat card that cancels the penalty!

Who is this game for?

Both kids and grown-ups will enjoy this game. Fairytale characters create a magical atmosphere and there is a hint of humour in each character.

What can we learn?

This game helps the kids to develop their memory, to learn how to control their emotions, to bluff and to think strategically.

225146.name: The Lost Age Quick Start Guide
225146.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This quick start guide for The Lost Age includes a condensed rulebook, six pre-generated characters, character-specific quick reference sheets, a region map, and a pre-made adventure to get you started.

User summary:

The Lost Age Quick Start Guide typically is distributed as a ZIP archive containing:


62-page rules document
9-page introductory adventure ("Shipwrecked on Em-Konoth")
six 2-page pre-generated characters
4-page character quick reference guide
JPG map file of The Land of Khem

225147.name: Weapons of Body and Soul
225147.description:
A Game of Martial Mastery and High Energy Action

From the introduction:

Weapons of Body and Soul is focused on Martial Arts in a wire-fu/Xianxia style setting. This is similar to Shonen manga such as Dragonball and One Piece, or movies like Crouching Tiger, Hidden Dragon. Primarily, characters will find themselves wandering plains, mountains and forests. Encountering villages that need help, beasts hungry for a meal, a villain on his way to power, or perhaps even a demon with nefarious plans. While the setting is mostly based in what you would find in old Asian fables, that is not the only setting possible.

225149.name: TRIPLEX
225149.description:
Description from the designer:

TRIPLEX is three games of Tic Tac Toe, all played at once, on the same board with movable pieces. The goal is just as simple as that of Tic Tac Toe: to form alignments of three in a row. The goal is also to form one alignment of all three types of pieces all at the same time.

In turns, players play any one of their pieces into any open space. Once all pieces have been played onto the board they may then be moved from where they were played into any open space. The first player to form all three types of alignments at the same time wins.

TRIPLEX is a board game that designers have been trying to create for over a century. TRIPLEX is the worlds only easily comprehensible, highly enjoyable and truly three dimensional strategic board game.

225150.name: Mastery Systems: Combative Arts and Arts Majika 1
225150.description:
From the introduction:

The Combative Arts Mastery System is the weapons ability system used in the Worlde of Legends game. There are four different combative art forms as described below. Each one offers unique weapon or attack skills that help make your Adventurer the legendary hero you wish for.

225151.name: Mastery Systems: Combative Arts and Arts Majika 2
225151.description:
From the introduction:

The first of the Combative Arts Mastery paths is General Weapons Mastery. It is designed for those players who just want a sword or a war hammer or some other melee weapon. General Weapons Mastery is highly focused on the use of close combat with hand‐held weapons. Adventurers who choose this path will list General Weapons Mastery as either their Primary or Secondary Ability.

225152.name: The Divinities: The Worlde of Kaendor Pantheon
225152.description:
User summary:

Presents brief statistical data and line illustrations of fifty-nine divinities of the campaign setting.

225153.name: Kaendor Mini Atlas
225153.description:
From the introduction:

Kaendor is the third planet in its solar system. It is a diverse planet teeming with life. The flora and fauna are vast and varied. It is a large planet (approximately 30,000 miles in diameter) that has a 288 day orbit around its sun, called Saen. Kaendor has varied climates, terrains, and environments.

225154.name: Creating Your Adventurer (QuickStart Edition)
225154.description:
From the introduction:

The Worlde of Legends QuickStart Rules will provide an array of fifteen different Ready-to-Play Adventurers. Custom Adventurer generation will not be available in the QuickStart Rules, but will surely be available in the full Core Rules Guidebook when it is released.

User summary:

This item describes various abilities and qualities of characters in the game. It does not provide any pre-generated characters, but does include a blank character record sheet.

225155.name: Worlde of Legends Combat
225155.description:
From the introduction:

Combat is an essential element to the roleplaying game experience. It is the source of the exciting action scenes and often yields the amazing feats for which Worlde of Legends heroic adventurers are known. A balanced FRPG game will have a good mix of roleplay and combat, allowing players to learn more about their adventure character's personality and have a great time engaging the enemy in combat.

225156.name: Learned Skills Mastery System
225156.description:
From the introduction:

On occasion, Adventurers are required to utilize skills other than those of weapons combat and majik and other than those which are inherent to all peoples. These skills are called Learned Skills. Learned Skills are the skills which an Adventurer learns in order to achieve actions which require a bit more knowledge than common sense and a bit more skill than natural actions require.

225157.name: Majik: How It Works and the Elements Behind It
225157.description:
From the introduction:

The Worlde of Legends universe, called The Vastness, is composed of minute threads of majikal energy. There are three major types of majikal energy in the Vastness, referred to as Dormant Majik and Active Majik and one minor type called Indifferent Majik.

225158.name: Inherent Skills and Strength Indicators
225158.description:
From the introduction:

Many game systems only allow certain skill sets for certain classes or archetypes. Worlde of Legends believes that all Adventurers have certain inherent skills. Whether you are a farmer or a high level rogue or a superior warrior should perhaps determine how good you are at certain skills but not whether or not you are capable of having a skill.

225159.name: Worlde of Legends Reference Lists
225159.description:
User summary:

Presents extensive equipment, weapons, and armor lists with costs and a few other details. Also presents hireling and service costs and tables showing units of measure.

225160.name: The Races and Cultures of Kaendor
225160.description:
From the introduction:

The Worlde of Legends campaign worlde offers twelve playable races, many of which have subraces, giving a total of thirty cultures available for you to select your Adventurer [sic]. Many of these are standard cultures everyone is familiar with from one game or another, others are interesting cultures you may not have been able to play in a RPG before.

225161.name: Official Worlde of Legends Quickstart Adventurer Sheet
225161.description:
User summary:

This document presents a four-page character reference sheet intended for print-and-play use.

225162.name: The Languages of Kaendor
225162.description:
From the introduction:

Most folk on the planet of Kaendor speak their native racial tongue as well as Common Kaendoran. Nearly all cultures raise their children to speak both languages. Many are fluent in other languages as well, but only the spellcasters, the scholars, and a few select others are well versed in Ancient Kaendoran - the language of the old world before the Great KaendFire devastated it.

225163.name: Reworld
225163.description:
In Reworld, players attempt to terraform a newly discovered planet, and to do that they need to use terrabots to establish new cities and shuttles to deliver materials that will populate those locations.

In game terms, over five rounds players fill the five levels of their spaceship with tiles featuring terrabots, shuttles, material vessels, and satellites. Each round twenty of these tiles are placed at random around the perimeter of a large ship, and each player receives a hand of cards. On a turn, a player can play one or more cards to claim a tile following these rules:


If neither tile adjacent to the desired tile has been claimed, the player can lay down any card next to this tile, claim it, then place it in the leftmost space of the level of their spaceship that matches the number of the card played. If you play a 4, for example, then you must place that tile in the leftmost position of your fourth level.



If one tile adjacent to the desired tile has been claimed, then you must lay down a card of the same number used to claim that previous tile or any two cards of your choice (with those two cards thus serving as a joker). Whatever number is topmost indicates the level of your spaceship on which you must place this tile.



If both tiles adjacent to the desired tile have been claimed and the cards used to claim them show the same number, then you do the same as described above. If the cards have different numbers, however — e.g., 1 and 3 — then you must lay down the same two numbers (1 and 3), one matching number and any other two cards, or any four cards. You place this tile on your spaceship in the same manner previously desired.


Once everyone has no cards in hand or cannot play further, the round ends. Any remaining tiles are thrown away, then you reset the board and deal out a new hand of cards. After five rounds, players now deploy these tiles onto the new planet, each turn playing 1-3 of the leftmost tiles from the row of their choice to create their personal terraformed world. If you deploy a terrabot, which are labeled A-E, you start a new city with this letter or extend an existing city of yours. Material vessels, which come in five colors, can be delivered to the planet's surface only if attached to shuttles, and each city can have vessels of only a single color. Satellites provide bonus scoring when added to a city. Shuttles and satellites can also be used for shields to protect your newborn planet.

Players earn points during the first half of the game for picking up terrabots and having cards left in hand. During the second half, players score for deploying satellites and for meeting targets set at the start of the game, e.g. having a city with eight tiles in it, having a city of each letter, emptying a level on your spaceship, having a certain number of shields, etc.

Once all the spaceships are empty, players score their final points for how well they've developed each city and their shields in comparison with their fellow terraformers. Whoever scores the most points wins!

225164.name: Card Clash
225164.description:
Description from the designer:

Card Clash is a quick game that sees 2 players attacking and counterattacking with cards whose type preference beats the previously played card. If your opponent can't counter your attack with any of the 4 cards in their hand, you win the round! But each successive round adds a new set of stronger cards into both players' decks, so try to get the first attack in to knock out your opponent before they get a chance to play a devastating attack! The first to win 2 rounds wins the game.

225165.name: The Rotating Labyrinth
225165.description:
Prison Without Guard

Publisher's blurb:

The Rotating Labyrinth is a complex one-shot dungeon geared toward players with a love of puzzles and spatial reasoning. The maze changes constantly but in a way that makes physical sense and can be tracked. It typically runs 3-6 hours for a level 5 party of four.

Files include a full description of how to run the labyrinth and instructions to create a model including printouts.

225166.name: Rogue State
225166.description:
Rogue State is a solitaire geo-political conflict simulation where the player assumes the role of the Supreme Leader of the Democratic People’s Republic of Korea (DPRK). As Supreme Leader, you will make all decisions on behalf of your nation to include:


The appointment (and removal) of cabinet ministers
The acceptance of foreign financing
The investment of resources into governmental sectors (Public Services, Industrial, Military, and Nuclear Weapons)
The compliance or disregard of UN mandates related to nuclear development
The oppression of society
The maintenance of diplomatic relations with historical allies
The application of bribery to cabinet ministers
The analysis of intelligence to make risk-based decisions
The issuance of threats against the West


The primary objective will be for the player's regime to survive from 1953 through the year 2030. The secondary objective will be to maximize adherence to the Juche ideology by progressively achieving national self-reliance. Juche points are earned by advancing the primary indicators of Nationalism, Military Strength, Industrial Development, and Nuclear Weapons Development while minimizing lingering foreign debt.

The game is played over a series of 12 turns, each representing seven years of history. Each turn consists of a series of steps:

Appoint New Cabinet Ministers:
There are four major cabinet positions that will serve under your leadership: Public Services Minister, Industry Minister, Defense Minister, and Atomic Development Minister. Each minister is represented by one six-sided die which is rolled every four turns and assigned to an office. The roll indicates the minister's skill level. The higher a minister’s skill level, the greater their level of performance (as well as their level of ambition to become the new Supreme Leader).

Gain Resources:
Resource cubes are earned from three sources: Industrial Production (which increases with the DPRK's level of Industrial Development); Foreign Support from Russia and China (according to the current status of Foreign Relations); and by obtaining loans (Foreign Debt) from allies.

Resolve Sanctions:
Dice rolls are used to determine if the UN places (or increases) economic sanctions on the DPRK based on the DPRK's level of Nuclear Development. The player must choose to either comply with the mandates by dismantling your nuclear program or ignore the mandates and have sanctions tightened.

Gather Intelligence--Determine High-Risk Events:
The player gathers intelligence by rolling dice to determine which threat events are "high risk" in the current turn. The probability of meeting a triggering condition grows as the severity of the situation increases. Threat events include: High Value Target Strikes, Military Coups, Tactical Strikes, Famines, and Revolutions.

Budget Resources:
The player now applies resources acquired in the Gain Resources phase to a number of investment areas: Social economy investments; Industrial & infrastructure investments; Defense investments; Research, Development, & Testing investments; Diplomatic investment; Bribery; Purges; Heavy Oppression; and Foreign Debt repayment. The Supreme Leader must choose wisely regarding how to best invest DPRK's limited resources. Short-term decisions may have no long-term value other than to enhance your regime's chances of survival through the next turn. Proper decision-making will require keen insight into the complex interaction of events that seek to defeat you.

Purge Appointees:
The player has the option of purging one or more cabinet appointees. This is done by re-rolling their die with the hope of gaining a minister with greater skill (if poor performance was an issue) or less skill (since too many highly skilled ministers pose a threat to your authority).

Run Economy:
The combination of cabinet minister skill, resources applied, and die rolls are then used to resolve the effects of your decisions on your nation's economy. This will result in adjustments to the primary governmental indicators (Nationalism, Industrial Development, Military Strength, and Nuclear Weapons development). Increasing development in each sector will reward you with related economic and strategic advantages. A struggling economy will introduce added risks.

Issue Threat
If Nuclear Weapons Development is sufficiently advanced, the player may issue threats to the West and its allies which may result in certain strategic advantages. Concessions (resources) may be gained from other countries in an effort to quell your sabre-rattling. Your threats may impress and embolden your military leadership (mitigating the risk of Military Coup). Your brinkmanship could discourage the West from considering an immediate Tactical Strike.

Adjust Regional Tensions:
Regional tensions are adjusted based upon decisions made earlier in the turn and are increased due to: The occurrence of major incidents; successful advances in your nuclear weapons program, and Threats being issued.

Check/Resolve Foreign Relations:
Resources applied to Diplomacy, the current level of Regional Tensions, and a die roll are used to resolve possible improvements (or further deterioration) in relations with Russia and China. Ensuring strong ties will provide strategic advantages such as increased economic support and military protection.

Resolve High-Risk Events:
Any threat events determined from the Intelligence phase to be "high risk" are now resolved. Resolution is performed using the number of resources applied to mitigating investments and a die roll. Effects could range from a foreign attack that diminishes the player's economic standing to the forceful removal of the player from power (ending the game).

Reset the Board:
Assuming the regime has survived all high-risk event resolutions the board is reset for the next turn starting with the Appoint New Cabinet Ministers phase. If the player's regime remains intact by the end of the final turn, the final Juche score is calculated from all economic indicators to determine your effectiveness as the Supreme Leader.

Rogue State has been entered in the 2016-17 Wargame Print and Play Contest.

225167.name: Human Punishment
225167.description:
Humans become lazy and create machines for their work. They gave them hands to feel and a mind to think. The machines think... this was a bad mistake!

Human Punishment is a hidden identity, hidden team deduction game where each player takes on the role of a Human, a Machine or an Outlaw in a distant future. Players must investigate others to figure out who is on their side, grab one of the 2 different weapons (long and short range), and eliminate the enemies. Stay focused.... maybe there are hidden enemies on your Team! Find your allies, trust no one!

Human Punishment is a social deduction 2.0 board game (4-8 players) with 3 races (Humans, Machines and Outlaws) and lot's of Hidden character-roles! The brand new Traitor mechanic will evolve the table into a social experiment.

225168.name: Total mania junior!
225168.description:
Family board game including 12 different games:


Quiz!
Sketch!
Blind sketch!
Sculpture!
Pantomime!
Stand up comedy!
Song!
Spelling!
Scrabble!
Hangman!
Inverse reading!
Vocabulary!

225169.name: Ein offensichtlicher Fall
225169.description:
[User summary]

Ein offensichtlicher Fall is Redaktion Phantastik's contribution to Gratisrollenspieltag 2017. It includes a very briaf summary of the rules for the Private Eye rpg, pregenerated characters, and an introductory murder mystery.

225170.name: Equinox Quickstart Set
225170.description:
From publisher blurb:

In the dark night of a distant future, the shattered remains of Earth drift through the cold void of space. The shadows of the past have been driven away, and the dark clouds at the horizon appear to be man-made. After the Great Netherwar, which resulted in the destruction of Earth, mankind is restless, scattered across the void, bereft of its cradle. The Sol system became the last safe hideout for outcasts both mystic and mundane. Known as Vagrants, they are rebels to the oppressive might of the Consortium — the government ruling over what’s left of Earth and its colonies. True freedom can only be found among the stars, the voices of the galactic underground say.

To them, the war isn’t over. It has only just begun.

Ride hybrid ships through astral space connecting planets and galaxies, wield awesome mystic powers, nethertech relics, and cutting-edge technology! Take on the role of a restless wanderer — someone living on the fringes of galactic society, scraping by in a war-torn system or even stealing other people’s stuff. Whether a misfit, scoundrel, mercenary, pirate, idealist, explorer, or just someone who walked away from his home in search of adventure: you are part of the galactic underground. Fight the nightmares that invaded the universe, start a revolution against the fascistic and corrupted Consortium government and explore space beyond the Veil...

equinox is a future fantasy roleplaying game of stunning action, frightening intrigue, and mystical powers. This Quickstart Set allows you to play a game of equinox right away and gives first insights into the game world and mechanics.

225171.name: Menschen würfeln
225171.description:
[User summary]
Menschen würfeln is Arne Babenhauserheide's contribution to Gratisrollenspieltag 2017. It consists of several tables for generating random NPCs, including both physical characteristics and demeanor.

225173.name: Ein Magiertraum
225173.description:
[User summary]

Ein Magiertraum is Redaktion Phantastik's contribution to Gratisrollenspieltag 2017. It includes a very brief summary of the rules for the Seelenfänger rpg, pregenerated characters, and an introductory sceanrio set in a small village.

225174.name: Occult Archetypes II
225174.description:
From publisher blurb:

Unlock the Mysteries of the Mind!

Occult Archetypes II opens up new vistas of psychic secrets and mental magic for your Pathfinder campaign! The new psychic rules and occult oddities found in Pathfinder Roleplaying Game Occult Adventures open up a vast new playground for heroes and villains of every kind, and within these pages you'll find incredible new options for psychic spellcasters and non-psychic classes that dabble in the magic of the mind! You'll find 16 awesome archetypes, from psychic warriors like the iron mind barbarian, indomitable kineticist, and martial seer paladin to scholars like the astropsychic, tranquil occultist, kinetic wizard, and aura master! You'll also find almost 20 innovative and exciting new feats for unlocking your character's psychic potential, like Incredible Hidden Power and Serene Ascendance, or focusing the power they already have like Accelerating Kinetics and Mask of Raw Divinity!

225175.name: The Unwise Young, They Say Do Ne'er Live Long
225175.description:
From publisher blurb:

A Mini-Dungeon adventure for 4-6 PCs of levels 12-13

Uskonto the Unshakeable, still a relatively young man, disappeared after taking responsibility for a child’s death when charging in to save a village. Rumor suggests he’s in Underworld, seeking atonement, but he’s needed! Perhaps allies can help the PCs, while foes will certainly hinder them...

225176.name: The Stuff of Dreams
225176.description:
From publisher blurb:

A Mini-Dungeon adventure for 4-6 PCs of levels 10-11

Deep in Underworld, near the outlet of a sacrificial wellshaft, the PCs find a colossal cavern full of densely packed mosses, liverworts, ferns, and bioluminescent fungi including many Armillaria and Mycenoid species. A sanctuary was created by survivors before they moved on, with corridors and rooms carved from the living biomass. Historically, the walls, floors, and ceilings were kept smooth, but Nature’s returned; now they’re unkempt, with vermin, animal, active plant, and other pathways pitting them. It’s unclear if the area is at “ground level” - in fact, it’s hundreds of feet above the cavern floor.

225177.name: The Chaosfire Incursion
225177.description:
From publisher blurb:

Don’t Get Burned in the Volcano of Chaos

The legendary volcano Mount Ymawaah suddenly appears near the city of Carnassat, unleashing a wave of fiery creatures on its citizens. Even worse, the volcano shows signs of erupting soon and destroying everything nearby. Only brave adventurers can discover who sent this destructive mountain to the city, learn this creature’s enigmatic purpose, and stop it before this city comes to ruin and destruction!

The Chaosfire Incursion is an exciting adventure module in Jon Brazer Enterprises’ Deadly Delves series and is compatible with the best-selling Pathfinder Roleplaying Game

7 New and Variant Monsters and a New Trap for your Pathfinder campaign
Three Full-Color Maps, each depicting a different level in the underground labyrinth of this otherworldly volcano
2 New Magic Items
Details on the City of Carnassat a great jumping off point for your own adventures
Enough content to get your group of 11th-level PCs all the way to 12th level

225178.name: Moneytime
225178.description:
Description from the designer:

Moneytime is a basketball card game that aims to deliver the sensations of a basketball game.

Each player plays a team and plays each basketball possession to try to score baskets, and playing defense and offense alternatively (like basketball).

By playing his offensive cards against the defensive cards in the possessions, the player playing offense will try to build an advantage to score using basketball actions with the ball, and without the ball wisely to avoid turnovers.

Simple and fast paced, Moneytime is designed around the notion of time, where individual highlights and simple collective mechanics are key, while shots at the buzzer and crazy end games are not rare.

Sound from a basketball perceptive, it remains true to the spirit of the game and reflects how basketball is to be played.

Typically a two players game, It can also be played by up to six players.

225183.name: Red Dragon Storm
225183.description: Red Dragon Storm is a strategic wargame of the Sino-Vietnamese War, 1979.

225184.name: A07 Mothik's Lair/A08 The Wyldwood Race
225184.description:
From publisher blurb:

Two 5E adventures in one! A party of adventurers are asked to slay a dragon and retrieve a powerful sword. Duke Kellan thinks he knows where the dragon's lair is located. Later, the heroes enter the annual wagon race known as the Wyldwood Race. They must race a number of other teams through the woods and down mountain trails. The prizes include heaps of gold and their lives!

For characters levels 10-12. This continues the Adventures in Myrr! A 60 page double adventure set in the World of Myrr.

Interesting NPCs
New Monsters
Encounter tables and monster lists
Traps and Treasure

225185.name: The Royal Panoply of Annem Ka
225185.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The Royal Panoply of Annem Ka details both a set of potent magical items - with a largely Egyptian aesthetic - and the pantheon of deities to which they are tied. Within you can read their history and their powers, along with advice on how they could be used to create compelling campaigns.

225186.name: People With Two Sides
225186.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Despite containing only four characters, this piece details a Judge, a Pirate, a Noblewoman, a Bouncer, a Student Mage, a Mother, a Boxer and a Doctor.

The deepest people have more than one side to who they are, and this piece provides both sides and details how those sides coexist within a single complex character.

225187.name: Red Lock Bay
225187.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Explore this hidden hamlet where pirates spend their rest days, and the structures and people that make it all possible, then follow the story of some of the pirate ships that visit the island regularly.

225188.description:
Description from the publisher:

"We come now to the very brink, where hope and despair are akin. To waver is to fall."
–Aragorn, The Return of the King

Dire, world-shattering stakes. Epic Multiplayer Mode. The fate of all Middle-earth… Mountain of Fire is the sixth and final The Lord of the Rings Saga Expansion for The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game!

Three epic scenarios grant you the opportunity to adventure alongside Aragorn and Frodo Baggins as they march to the Black Gate, carry the One Ring into the heart of Mordor, and climb the final steps to the fires of Mount Doom. These scenarios are inspired directly by The Return of the King, and their apocalyptic, world-altering stakes are reflected by the introduction of the dire keyword, which raises the threat elimination level to "99," and by rules that allow you play the final two scenarios simultaneously in Epic Multiplayer Mode, either in standalone play or as the climactic finale to your The Lord of the Rings Saga Campaign!

And it's not just the scenarios that are bigger and more fantastic than ever. Mountain of Fire is loaded with new heroes, allies, events, and attachments that truly convey the awesome resolve of those noble and daring Men, Elves, Dwarves, and Hobbits that stood at the end against the forces of Mordor.
225188.name: The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game – The Mountain of Fire
boardgamefamily: Lord of the Rings: The Card Game (LCG)

225190.name: Gates of Gehenna
225190.description:
From the introduction:

Gates of Gehenna [is a] Cloak & Dagger-style role-playing game about personal ambition, religious conflict and survival in an uncaring world.
...
Gates of Gehenna is [set] in a twisted fantasy world close to the end times during a development stage not unlike our own late renaissance, when great religious wars are fought within a crumbling empire of old.

Everywhere the tell-tale signs can be found, crops go bad animals are infected with strange diseases, while beasts and worse have overrun the countryside, doomsayers plague cities as do widespread illness and war, as political and religious motives cross towards dangerous holy wars between the remnants of once-great empires amidst the ruins of ages.

Above all a strange cult, the Eye and Star, have proclaimed the dawn of the end times and many believe the opening of the Gates may be near, the time when the world shall end, and all be lost to the unspeakable void.

User summary:

The resolution mechanic uses an interesting dice-step/dice-pool method with small pools. Characters have Talents which are an interesting blend of Skills and Traits; Talents can be improved with experience.

225191.name: Metal Warrior (C64)
225191.description:
User Summary

A Commodore 64 remake of "Metal Warrior: Hessian Adventure in Dismal Future" - with an altered plot and different gameplay - and the first in the Metal Warrior series. Players take control of a young metal guitarist named Ian, as he tries to investigate the death of his best friend and uncover a conspiracy targeting metal guitarists. NPCs can be interacted with to gain new clues and advance the story. An inventory bar allows the player to carry various items, including a variety of weapons and consumables. Items can be purchased from shops within the city or collected from defeated enemies. The game's story is divided into episodes, with cutscenes in between each episode.


Although technically a C64 game, the game has always been a download, no physical copies exist. The game is meant to be downloaded from the Internet to be run on an emulator, the files are in the format of a C64 diskette so probably could also be transferred onto a real physical C64... somehow.

225192.name: Wallet Civ in Space!
225192.description:
Description from the designer:

Wallet Civ in Space! is a 9 card pen and paper game. Print or write out the 9 instruction cards, and on the reverse of each card, you will create your space mining empire.

Each turn, shuffle the deck, set aside 2 of the cards not in play this turn, play out 4 cards "space" side up to build upon, and then the remaining 3 cards "instruction" side up to see what you can do! Then shuffle up the 9 cards again.

Please see https://www.boardgamegeek.com/thread/1577111/wallet-civ-9-ca... for rules.

225193.name: Noir World
225193.description:
Publisher description
Noir World is film noir as powered by the Apocalypse. Around your table you'll choose from 20 Roles, create relationships between them, build a City, and maybe solve a Crime, all while trying to create the best Movie possible.

It's powered by the Apocalypse, the same mechanics found in Apocalypse World, Dungeon World, Headspace, and Monsterhearts, but it's different - there's no set single person acting as a GM. Here, everyone will have a chance to be the Director, everyone is the GM.

225194.name: A Duty to be Done
225194.description:
From the introduction:

It is mid spring and since the melting of the snows, your thoughts have turned to your old life as adventurers. Old life... that sums it up, more or less. You have not done anything that came close to being adventuring since you rescued the King’s sister, Princess Elivia, from the clutches of the faerie, nearly a year ago. Since then you have not left the small Barony of Springdale.

User summary:

A scenario created for Conquest 2014.

225195.name: Death at Fay Bridge
225195.description:
From the introduction:

The Tourney at Fay Bridge is an annual event, and draws large numbers of knights and lords from across Ellesland. A large faire has become part of this event, which also helps cater for the large number of peasants that are drawn to this exciting affair. Hosted by Lord Fay Bridge, it is held on the outskirts of the town of Fay Bridge, and involves several days of feasting, deal making and breaking, and knightly competitions.

User summary:

For 4 - 6 characters of 7th rank. Developed for Arcanacon XXVIII.

225196.name: The Cold Wind Comes
225196.description:
From the introduction:

The Feast of St. Stephan is about to begin. You have returned to the village of your birth for the winter, the first Feast since seeking adventure with your friends. These twelve days promise to be a time of fine food, warm ale, and good fellowship.

User summary:

For 4 - 6 characters of 7th rank. Developed for Conquest 2009.

225197.name: From Four, Comes All
225197.description:
From the introduction:

Near the borders of Albion and Thuland – just a mile or inside the Albish side of the line established after the last border war a century ago within the border Barony of Tarrowwood, lies an ancient temple nestled in the foothills of the mountain ranges. Long abandoned, and known only to a few because of its solid iron, never rusting doors, this was once the centre of worship for the old elemental Druidic religion of the region.

User summary:

Developed for Unicon 2014.

225199.name: The Fall of Erincastra
225199.description:
From the introduction:

...and so it came to pass that the Legions withdrew from Ellesland, for such was the danger to the Empire’s heart that even a healthy and strong limb might be sacrificed to preserve the life of the whole. But the chaos of the retreat meant that when the Thuls came over the broken wall that last time they struck south with such ferocity that they were at the walls of the city within only eight days and there was neither time to reinforce from local Auxiliaries nor to carry the treasures of the Church to a place of true safety. All that is known is that the Bishop and a handful of Priests took up arms and removed the casket from the altar of the Cathedral and left the city by the southern gates as the barbarians swarmed through the northern gate. And one of the greatest relics of the True Faith was lost to the sight and knowledge of man, to the detriment of Legend and the Holy Church...

User summary:

Developed for Conquest, 2012.

225200.name: The Herald's Request
225200.description:
From the introduction:

A couple of months after the characters have returned from the tourney games at Fay Bridge (A Death At Fay Bridge), life has settled back to normal. Lars has found that having a Lady (Knight) as a lover is not as good as he once thought. Baron Turquin is finding the day-to-day life as a landed noble to be less exciting (boring) than the life of an adventurer. Only Anarchos seems to be happy, as he is finding the time for research for a change.

User summary:

Developed for Conquest, 2010.

225201.name: The Lord of Gorburn
225201.description:
From the introduction:

This is a short scenario for 4-6 characters of approximately 7th rank, set in the western lands of the fief of Baron Aldred in the kingdom of Albion. Specifically written for convention play, it should slot into many other campaigns.

User summary:

Developed for Arcanacon XXVII.

225202.name: Wither'd Murder
225202.description:
From the introduction:

The party, consisting of Lord Turquin of Springdale and his retinue are travelling from Vantery in the County of Braeburg to Meore on the coast of Chaubrette. They had been commissioned by the King of Albion to deliver certain exceptionally important (but secret) documents to the Count of Braeburg – His Majesty needed a group of people who could pass as adventurers but who were lead by somebody with the rank to be taken seriously as an emissary of the King, and Turquin and his companions fitted the bill perfectly. It is autumn as they travel up the road that runs alongside a river through a combination of woodlands and farmlands.

User summary:

Developed for Conquest, 2013.

225203.name: The Super Mage Bestiary
225203.description:
From publisher blurb:

The SUPER MAGE BESTIARY (or SMB) is a collection of creatures for GMs to use in magic-oriented superhero campaigns. THE ULTIMATE SUPER MAGE (USM) included many magical creatures, but there just wasn’t enough space to provide a really good assortment. Some types of creatures had to be ignored completely. Now, however, the GM of a Super Mage campaign has scads of spirits, magical races, and monsters available at his or her fingertips. What’s more, GMs will have patterns they can use to design more monsters of their own.

225204.name: City Hall
225204.description:
From publisher blurb:

This product is a 48 x 20 inch, Battlemap of a City Hall Lobby , it has Hex, Square and No Overlays, it also includes the VTT files for online play.

“They say you can’t fight city hall, but they didn’t say anything about BLOWING it up! Ah ha ha! When the mayor’s speech ends, tick tock stop and then BOOM!”—The Arsenalist

City Hall includes a single level interior map of a city hall with a podium and a larger room with 32 chairs set up for an audience for the mayor’s speech.

City Hall is intended for use in modern and supers games. It could also see use in horror games where the citizens meet up to discuss strange happenings in the town. Perhaps they even come face to face with the source of those supernatural occurrences as it becomes attracted to a location with so many people in one place. The mayor could also be involved in a cult devoted to the bizarre entity and the mayor’s role in the cult is suppression of the cult’s activities from public knowledge in the media until the final ritual is complete.

Adventure hook for use with this map:

Final Speech: The Arsenalist is an insane super villain with a grudge against the mayor of Broadhampton. He has spent hard time in Broadhampton Prison for the crime of blowing open the Broadhampton Bank vault with explosives and was caught trying to escape with the cash from the vault by a superhero after the heist. The Arsenalist is delusional and blames the mayor for not pardoning him for his crime of armed robbery and blames her for all the years spent in prison.

He has planted a bomb in Broadhampton City Hall with a unique sonic-based trigger mechanism. It will only begin with the mayor’s voice being amplified by a microphone. The bomb is rigged to explode if the mayor stops speaking for longer than a minute after activating. The bomb is obvious once triggered, making a “tick tock; don’t stop” recording that repeats on a loop in The Arsenalist’s voice.

The Arsenalist is on hand outside to prevent any superheroes from interfering with his plan. He is looking for the superhero that caught him and put him in jail, hoping this lure will draw out his true target, who happens to be one of the superhero player characters who rush to the scene to diffuse the bomb!

225205.name: Demons
225205.description:
From publisher blurb:

This product presents a variety of demonic foes to pitch against your heroes. Within, you will find:

The Executioner Demon, a naturally armored opponent with blades instead of forearms and hands. They are deadly combatants and tenacious foes.
What could be more terrifying than a Hellwyrm, a dragon native to the demonic realm?
The Low One demon, a tentacled blob, is born of the lowest form of damned souls. Near mindless, these creatures just want to eat everything in sight, including your character.
The Mistress of Pain uses her barbed chains to torture and interrogate prisoners on behalf of her masters. Her love of pain also makes her a difficult fight.

225206.name: VIXIV: Thus Lived
225206.description:
Description from the publisher:

VIXIV is a fast paced strategic card game that pits players against each other in a race to develop the most successful ecosystem. Using a variety of real wildlife species, players must amass the most points possible while pushing each other out of the limited play space.

The draw a card, play a card turn system keeps things fast paced and encourages players to think quickly to address problems as they happen. Each turn allows players to support their existing animal species, expand their range on the board, or ruin the plans of other players.

The game ends when the turn limit is reached and no more cards are left to play. The player with the most points on the board wins.

225207.name: Discussion
225207.description:
Description from the designer:

Discussion, a game of conversations, is a 18 cards microgame in which you try to create a coherent speech using your resources at hand and your memory, and forcing your opponent to flip its ideas.

Discussion is being played with an 18 cards deck with different symbols on them. It is very important to differentiate between the front and back of each card. The backs contain only two symbols, 9 corresponding to one player (red) and 9 for the other (green). The hand of each player is always held with the backs facing the opposite player. The cards are played next to others on the table showing their back sides and triggering some effects. You win by forming a group of connected cards of your color greater than your opponent’s.

225208.name: 7th Guest: The Board Game
225208.description:
Description from the publisher:

In the world of The 7th Guest: The Board Game, you re-enter the mysterious and magical Stauf mansion, filled with diabolical puzzles, riddles and other mind games to test your wits and knowledge against your friends and family. But as with all haunted houses, know that you enter at your own risk. The goal is to emerge with your sanity - and your soul – intact.

The board game remains true to the original award winning computer game, although now you play the role of one of the six guests in direct competition with the other guests. Starting from the Foyer, you are randomly assigned destination rooms to which you must go, by roll of the Magic Die, and there, solve the mysteries and challenges within. Be the first to finish your tour of the mansion, arrive at the final destination, the Little Room at the Top, solve the final puzzle there, and you best your fellow guests and achieve your heart's most secret desire. Which, for one thing, is to best your fellow guests.

The puzzle types range from logic puzzles, to spatial problems, to riddles and cryptic clues to trivia. You never know what you'll get. Some may be easy, but some may be real brain freezers. But Stauf, being a fair-minded host, has provided up to three hints for the more difficult problems. But using the hints comes at a price, naturally. Nothing is free, you know. And in Stauf's world, no good deed goes unpunished.

(Note that whereas The 7th Guest and The 11th Hour had a little less than 90 logic puzzles & brain teasers between them, the basic tabletop game comes with 300, and that's just for starters.)

And if you can't solve the puzzle put to you, the other guests will have a chance to “steal” it from you by answering it instead. So be vigilant and pay attention to not only your own puzzles, but to the puzzles put to your fellow guests. You might just walk away with the prize that was once within their grasp. How delicious is that?

It all sounds pretty simple and straightforward, doesn't it? Well, not quite so fast. Simple, maybe. But straightforward? That's not exactly the way of the diabolical game maker, who here, has devised a number of Mystery Spells that are cast upon his guests, making things just a little trickier... and lot more interesting. Should you land on a Mystery space, you might be sent someplace you don't want to be. Or, you might be assigned extra rooms to unlock. Or, somebody might gain the power to “Steal” the answer to your puzzle from right under your nose. Again, you never know what you're going to get. But Stauf is,if nothing else, an equal opportunity evil doer... so all those bad things that can be inflicted on you can be inflicted on your opponents too. And take heart... for every evil spell, there is a good one too. Stauf isn't totally evil. Right?

225209.name: Faces of Illusion: The Twin Phantoms
225209.description:
A young journalist witnesses the kidnapping of a theatre star, Beatrice Le Brun. The ambitious girl then undertakes her own investigation.

As it turns out, the main suspect is one Charles Delacroix – a world-famous illusionist who mysteriously vanished some time ago.

When the journalist and her young associate – Beatrice’s brother – follow the kidnapper, more and more of the truth about the abduction and a mysterious romance come to light.

Is it all just smoke and mirrors, or true magic and pure evil? What really hides in the underbelly of the Parisian Theatre? Discover the identity of the kidnapper and thwart his plans before it’s too late!

Source: The Publisher Website.

225212.name: Halberds & Helmets: Running the Game
225212.description:
From the introduction:

This book is for the referee of the game.

User summary:

Extensive advice, alternate rules, and various resources for the game.

225213.name: Tugawords
225213.description:
Description from the publisher:

Tugawords is a super fast and brain powered version of Tug of War in which players alternate turns spelling backwards towards themselves and the first one to reach the finish wins. Your not so easy task is to pull the Flag to the Finish by spelling longer words than your opponent while trying to avoid being eliminated by Missed Spells.

At an average of 2-20 minutes per game, Tugawords is quick, unpredictable, open-ended and never has a chance to get boring.

Imagine a speed chess + spelling bee + tennis volley + tug of war...

Now you have an idea of Tugawords.

No points to count, no special tiles, and no predictable outcomes. Just win or lose and you can always tell where you are in the game...

boardgamepublisher: さとーふぁみりあ (Sato Familie)
225214.description:
User summary:

8ビットモックアップ (8bit MockUp) is a Japanese game that follows the true multi-player solitaire format of games like Take it Easy! or Karuba. Each player has an identical set of tiles, and plays the same tile at the same time to their own tableau. But where each player places each tile differs...

Each player, as an "Apprentice of a God", must create a world which is most favored by their mentor god, by connecting landscapes as ordered by the god.

This game is a tile-laying, puzzle-like game. Place tiles with matching edges. The game ends when 20 tiles are placed.

There are a couple of moments in the game where you are allowed to build Monuments, and those score you points depending on where you build them.

Like similar multi-player solitaires, you may combine multiple sets to increase the number of players. Whilst the game is published in Japanese, the gameplay is language free.

Description from the publisher:

プレイヤーは「神さまの見習い」となり、 神さまから提示される地形を上手に繋げて、神さまが気に入る国を作ります。
このゲームはタイル配置型のパズルライクなゲームです。
タイルの辺と辺の色が合致するように配置していき、20枚配置したらゲーム終了です。
ゲーム中に何度かモニュメントを建築するタイミングが現れます。
建築していた場所に応じて点数を獲得していきます。
複数セットのゲームをあわせることで最大何人でも遊べます。
225214.name: 8bit MockUp

225215.name: Capture the Grid
225215.description:
Description from the publisher:

Conquer the challenges to capture the grid. A game of wit, creativity, and skill! Be the first to complete all the zany challenges and lay down all your cards to Capture the Grid.

225216.description:
Description from the publisher:

In LA BISTRO each player starts with a small stake that they use to build up their restaurant and then with profits decide how much to invest further, either in improvements to counter what the opposition are doing or to create a second restaurant.

Simultaneous actions to take in this game:

Choose a building in one of six different types of neighborhoods to site your place.
Decide from one of eight types of cuisine.
Set your prices.
Hire kitchen staff to improve your food quality.
Hire wait staff to improve your level of service.
Renovate your space to improve your ambiance.
Advertise so that people know about you.




Do these in any order you like, but do them better than everyone else, and quickly! Before you know it the first customers will be rolling in!

Features many details of the restaurant business including differing neighborhoods, cuisine types and a wide variety of employees and renovations.

Customer visits are determined by a new gaming mechanism in which players roll 15 dice and place them in a unique way to determine which restaurants the fickle public taste adores.

At the end of the year though, it's the planner who has the most money who wins.
225216.name: LA BISTRO

225217.name: Pawsitively Historical
225217.description: The object of Pawsitively Historical is to be the first player to collect all historical pictures cards numbered from 1-14, in order. Roll the die and stretch your memory to find the hidden historical face cards in sequence. The 1st player to collect all 14 historical face cards in a row wins the game.

225218.name: Spacedogs
225218.description: A fast & furious flipping card game. Quickly flip over the top card from your pile and place it onto the center pile. Slap the center pile when you spot one of three things - two of the same cards in a row, two of the same separated one that is different, or one of the Meteor Shower cards. The first player to slap the pile collects all the cards in the center to add to their pile until all have been collected.

225219.name: Under the Sea
225219.description:
Description from the publisher:

The Outrageous and Sneaky Bluffing Card Game. Get rid of the cards in your hand by laying them down in sequence. If you don't have the next card in the sequence, bluff by laying down another card. But don't get caught. If your opponents call your bluff and catch you in a lie, you get all the cards in the pile!

225220.name: Raising a God
225220.description:
From the introduction:

This is a mini-campaign for players in their mid levels, levels five to ten. Player characters start looking for a place to build their castles and tower, thieves look to expand their network of spies and thieves, clerics start meddling in the affairs of the gods. Some of long term goals players might have: end the slave trade on Hinia Oot; raise the dead god of light, Arden; topple the reign of the grey elf witch Susrael; prevent the rise of the demon lord Tsathoggua.

User summary:

Usable with Labyrinth Lord and especially with Halberds & Helmets.

225221.name: Wreck and Ruin
225221.description:
From the introduction:

Wreck and Ruin is a short adventure designed to be played over one session. The plot is fairly linear, beginning with the wreck of the players ship. From there on the adventure takes the form of a series of strange occurrences, culminating in a final climactic battle in the Tower. This adventure is designed for relatively inexperienced characters, and is set up so that they will have to work together to survive. Further, this adventure will introduce them to the World of Legend, albeit a far flung part thereof and to the demands of a noble house of Albion.

This adventure was designed for four or five players of 1st or 2nd Rank.

User summary:

The scenario was developed for convention play. The PDF features multiple page sizes, some quite large.

225222.name: The Wyrm Turns
225222.description:
From the introduction:

A wet and shadowy limestone cavern beneath [a family] chapel. To gain access to the Worms Lair, one must perform a bloodrite on the altar stone within the chapel.

The family normally performs a symbolic ceremony but this year blood was accidentally spilled onto the stone.

User summary:

The scenario was developed for convention play.

225223.name: Pact: Agents of the C6
225223.description:
From the introduction:

In Pact: Agents of the C6, players take on the role of agents in service to the council of six. The Pact uses four core systems; the words of power, gauges, mutations and accomplishment points.
...
The default setting for this game is the modern world with one major difference; monsters, ghosts, demons, angels, and all other supernatural beings are real. Some of these other beings have used humans as food, guinea pigs, and even husks to walk upon the earth.

User summary:

This intriguing game uses some very unusual mechanics for characterization. Characters have "Gauges" which are loosely analogous to Attributes, but vary during play. Characters also select a "Path" which is somewhat like a Class in concept, though not very similar in function. Finally, characters have a unique blend of special qualities which are something like Traits.

225224.name: Pact: Agents of the C6 Character Sheet
225224.description:
User summary:

Several variations of a character sheet are provided for the game. Usually, these are distributed as one to several image files (each image a separate "page" of the character). They are intended for print-and-play use.

225225.name: The Herbal of the Holy Order of Sycrata
225225.description:
From the introduction:

Being A Scholarly Study Of The Use Of Herbs In Our World Of Legend, Commisioned For His Imperial Majesty, The Imperator Of The New Selentine Empire, And Compiled By Sir Aradax Seltar, Cataphract Of Tamor, Herbalist Of The Holy And Ancient Order Of Sycrata.

User summary:

This sourcebook is specific for Dragon Warriors and is derived primarily from The Guide to Herbs for RPGs.

225228.name: Survivalizm - The Animal Simulator
225228.description:
You are a wild spirit who is capable of coming into existence as any animal in a realistically replicated forest, where rules of the wild prevail. Fight or Flight, Mate, Grow your Herd, Leave a Legacy. Here you must survive, using your wits, strength, bravery and cunningness.

Source: The Game Website.

225229.name: The Joust
225229.description:
Description from the designer:

The Joust is a 2-player card game that uses a standard deck of cards along with the two jokers. You will also need pencil and paper or 4d6 [2- white, 1-red and 1-blue] used to track knight advantage and number of lances broken.

The design is component ready since it needs only a deck of cards and I will post the rules later today.

The Joust is played where two knights ride horses in a list with armor and lance trying to knock the other knight off his horse.

A win will be either unhorsing your opponent "which is an automatic win or breaking three lances.

As you ride down the list you will try to gain an advantage while also trying to center your lance on your opponents shield on impact.

You will use 8 cards to create the initial list. The jokers will represent each knight, and 9 cards [from each player] will represent each players shield.

225230.name: Peloponnes: Heroes and Colonies
225230.description:
Description from the publisher:

Peloponnes Heroes and Colonies will add Heroes with individual powers to the players and Colonies, which replaces the playerboards from the original game. All Colonies have different advantages and disadvantages.
A new "disaster" added with the Persians, who strikes twice in the game.
Gain strength while adding buildings and land to your civilisation to defend the Persians and other players.

Peloponnes Heroes and Colonies is a big new expansion for Peloponnes that comes in the same box size as the "Peloponnes Box".

225232.name: Kingdom of Heaven: 2nd and 3rd Crusades
225232.description: Kingdom of Heaven: 2nd and 3rd Crusades is an issue game of War Drum Games' wargame mook for beginners "Battle on the Table" #3. The game is solitaire. The player tries to defend the Latin Kingdom of Jerusalem against Muslim invasions. The system was inspired by Victory Point Games' Cruel Necessity.

225233.name: Twilight of the Reich: The Berlin Campaign 1945
225233.description: Twilight of the Reich: The Berlin Campaign 1945 is an issue game of War Drum Games' wargame mook for beginners "Battle on the Table" #4. The game is basically played by two players. Soviet player tries to occupy the whole of Berlin, German player tries to prevent it.

225234.name: Last Battle of Sanada Yukimura
225234.description: Last Battle of Sanada Yukimura is an issue game of War Drum Games' wargame mook for beginners "Battle on the Table" #5. The theme is summer campaign of Siege of Osaka, 1615. The game is basically played by two players. One commands Tokugawa force, the other Toyotomi force.

225235.name: First Snow
225235.description:
First Snow is a free Print&Play game about an Inuit wandering through the changing landscape, hunting for food, gathering wood, building simple tools and looking for the best shelter to keep himself warm. This gets more and more difficult as the winter swiftly approaches. And on top of all that, there’s this big terrifying polar bear…

The game uses an innovative worker placement mechanism combined with a resource management and a bit of bluffing. It uses dice in a few interesting ways but none of them require you to roll them. ;-)


GAMEPLAY

Every round players build a new landscape out of the 6 double sided land cards. As they do, they place their two camps along the way. Numbers on the chosen land cards determine the player order for the next round.

Every land card is divided in half, so you do not choose a single card, but you have to combine two of them to form the complete location for your camp.

At the start of the round, players secretly send their polar bear to one of the land cards and since you try to avoid the bear and want to get the best card at the same time, it brings a small bluffing aspect to the game.

After completing the landscape, players resolve their camps. One of the camps serve as a "day camp" and the other as a "night camp" and each of them has a bit different purpose.

While resolving a camp you can use all the resources shown on its location, but you have to fit them into your inventory to be able to use them later in the game. You can even build useful tools, but they take place in your inventory as well.
Scoring is resolved every round in your night camp and consists of feeding your Inuit and keeping him warm.

The land cards serve also as a timer. One of them is flipped the "winter" side up every round and the game ends when all the land cards got flipped.


The game was designed for the 2017 9-Card Nanogame P&P Design Contest.

225236.name: Assault on Hill 60
225236.description: This is the first game of Kilovolt Design's tactical mini wargame series "Winning or Losing". The theme is the Battle of Messines (1917) during World War I. The title is named after Australian war film Beneath Hill 60. The game is basically played by two players. British player tries to occupy Messines Ridge. German player tries to prevent it.

225237.name: Shadow of Wolves on a Moonlight Night
225237.description: This is the second game of Kilovolt Design's tactical mini wargame series "Winning or Losing". The theme is U-boats attack on Convoy SC 104 during World War II. The game is basically played by two players. German player commands U-boats and tries to sink Allied transport ships. Allied player tries to prevent it.

225238.name: Encounter above the Yalu
225238.description: This is the third game of Kilovolt Design's tactical mini wargame series "Winning or Losing". The theme is aerial combat in "MiG Alley" during Korean War. The game is basically played by two players. UN player commands USAF and tries to destroy a bridge over the Yalu. Communist player commands Soviet/Chinese MiGs and tries to defend the bridge.

225239.name: Lion of Sinai
225239.description: This is the fourth game of Kilovolt Design's tactical mini wargame series "Winning or Losing". The theme is tank combat in the Sinai Peninsula, 14-16 October 1973 during Yom Kippur War. The game is basically played by two players.

225240.name: Whisper of Destruction
225240.description:
From publisher blurb:

Set in the city of Selastos, this adventure for Bloodshadows Third Edition continues the events from the fiction in the rulebook. The characters are hired to find private detective Jack Deacon, who disappeared shortly after arriving in the city. Jack Deacon bested the spellslinger known as Whisper in the city of Galitia several months ago (these events are detailed in the Hell’s Feast novel). Deacon has been kidnapped, tortured, and threatened with death. Can your players find and rescue Deacon in time or will he simply become another stiff in Selastos?

"You made the greatest mistake a detective can make, Deacon. You ruled out the dead as suspects. A corpse can kill with impunity, that's the beauty of it all."

A new player character species is also included.

225241.name: True Lovers Run Into Strange Capers
225241.description:
From publisher blurb:

A Mini-Dungeon adventure for 4-6 PCs of levels 14-15

Eternity at the beck-and-call of an immortal outsider can become...”mundane”...while existing simply to extinguish other creatures’ lives eventually turns out to be equally tedious. But surprises rouse even the greatest of outerplanar beings from their ennui. And love is invariably a surprise.

225242.name: Stormy Moment
225242.description: This is the fifth game of Kilovolt Design's tactical mini wargame series "Winning or Losing". The theme is Battle of Vukovar during Croatian War of Independence. The game is 2 in 1: Battle of Vukovar and Battle of East Croatia.

225243.name: The Bishopric
225243.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Cross Family's power is waning in Wellstone City. They are struggling to appear even the least bit legitimate a the biggery syndicates start to crumble and the smaller organized gangs are starting to gain traction. Donovan Cross is trying to give all appearances of helping the city, cleaning up the Warrens, and turning over a new leaf.

Appearances, however, are not always what they seem. Rumors are spreading of corruption, bribery, even employing local gangs to keep the area clean around Donovan's newest project, The Bishopric. The building is to be almost self-sustaining, with living space for hundreds of people, shopping, entertainment, and restaraunt choices. But the shadow of the dark heart of the Cross Clan is starting to creep up on this shining spot of hope in the Warrens...

Help out the Crosses, gain some traction yourself, or sabotage the building completely...in Wellstone City, the choices are yours! Pick up this newest Wellstone City Wednesday and get in the action today!

225244.description:
Ticket to Ride: Germany is a standalone game in the Ticket to Ride series. Over the course of the game, players collect cards in order to then claim routes on the game board between two cities. Ideally the players create a network of routes that connect the cities showing on their secret ticket cards. Players score points both for claiming routes and for completing tickets, with incomplete tickets counting against a player's score.

In addition to scoring points for tickets, whenever a player places a route on the board, they claim a passenger from the two cities that form the endpoints for that route (assuming that the passengers have not already been claimed). At the end of the game, whoever has the most passengers of each of the six colors scores 20 points for that color; whoever has the secondmost passengers in a color scores 10 points. Whoever has the most points at the end of the game wins.

Ticket to Ride: Germany combines most of Zug um Zug: Deutschland and the Deutschland 1902 expansion in one box. Zug um Zug: Deutschland, published solely for the German and Austrian market, consisted of the same map as Ticket to Ride: Märklin, but ZuZ:D didn't include the passenger mechanism from Märklin in which players scored additional points by moving passengers from city to city. The Deutschland 1902 expansion introduced a different method of scoring passengers, and that method is now present in this collection.
225244.name: Ticket to Ride: Germany

225245.name: Starfinder Core Rulebook
225245.description:
UNRELEASED GAME

From publisher blurb:Strap in and blast off! The Starfinder Roleplaying Game puts you in the role of a bold science-fantasy explorer, investigating the mysteries of a weird and magical universe as part of a starship crew. Will you delve for lost artifacts in the ruins of alien temples? Strap on rune-enhanced armor and a laser rifle to battle undead empires in fleets of bone ships, or defend colonists from a swarm of ravenous monsters? Maybe you'll hack into the mainframe of a god-run corporation, or search the stars for clues to the secret history of the universe or brand new planets to explore. Whether you're making first contact with new cultures on uncharted worlds or fighting to survive in the neon-lit back alleys of Absalom Station, you and your team will need all your wits, combat skill, and magic to make it through. But most of all, you'll need each other.

This massive 528-page hardcover rulebook is the essential centerpiece of the Starfinder Roleplaying Game, with rules for character creation, magic, gear, and more—everything you need to play Starfinder as either a player or Game Master! The next great adventure in science-fantasy roleplaying takes off here, and the Starfinder Core Rulebook is your ticket to a lifetime of adventure amid the stars!

The Starfinder Core Rulebook includes:

All player and Game Master rules in a single volume.
Complete rules for science-fantasy races like logical androids, telepathic lashunta, ysoki ratfolk, and more —plus all of the classic fantasy races of the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game!
7 new science-fantasy classes, from the spellhacking technomancer to the starship mechanic with a remote-controlled robot. Will you be a heavily armored soldier, a charismatic envoy, a stealthy operative, an occult mystic, or the cosmically attuned solarian, who calls forth strange powers and shapes energy weapons from stars and black holes?
A detailed overview of Starfinder's core setting, including the planets of the Pact Worlds, their gods, major factions and threats, and more.
Complete rules for starship combat, as well as for building and customizing your starship.
Hundreds of science-fantasy weapons, armors, and items, both magical and technological, from plasma cannons and holy power armor to enchanted swords and cybernetic implants.
Hundreds of spells to let your mystic or technomancer tap into esoteric energies and rewrite the laws of physics.
Rules for alien environments, deadly traps, bizarre diseases and poisons, and everything else you need to craft exciting adventures.
Advice on converting Pathfinder RPG content to Starfinder, and vice-versa.
And much, much more!

225246.name: Alien Archive
225246.description:

From publisher blurb:Battle or befriend more than 80 bizarre life forms in this 160-page hardcover creature collection for the Starfinder Roleplaying Game! Every new world and space station comes with its own dangers, from strange new cultures to robotic killing machines to alien predators ready to devour unwary spacefarers. Inside this book, you'll find rules and ecologies for creatures from across the known worlds, plus alien equipment and more.

A robust system for creating your own creatures ensures that your parties never be without weird new aliens to fight or trade with, and racial rules for many of the new organisms let you be the alien, making Alien Archive not just a collection of creatures to kill, but a fascinating menu of creatures to be! Want to play a hyperevolved floating brain? A mighty dragonkin? A silicon-based crystalline slug? Explore the limits of your galaxy and your game with Starfinder RPG Alien Archive!

225247.name: Silver March Sentinel's Part 1
225247.description:
From the introduction:

You, for whatever reason, find yourself milling around Jalanthar restlessly. With almost no work around for a strong back, or dexterous hand, the village has little to offer the few idle people such as yourself. In which case you seem to find yourself gathering in or around the well-known Crowing Cockatrice inn at the end of each day to catch any news of work.

User summary:

225248.name: Starfinder First Contact
225248.description:

From publisher blurb:Creatures from Another World

The Starfinder Roleplaying Game arrives in August 2017, but the first aliens are landing right now! Within this top-secret dossier, you'll find a dozen otherworldly foes both bizarre and familiar, from the asteroid-dwelling sarcesians who ride solar winds on wings of light to technomagical undead horrors capable of ruling forever as the sinister Bone Sages of Eox. While all the creatures in this book are designed for use with Starfinder, all can be easily converted for use with Pathfinder, so there's no need to wait until August to start battling invaders from space!

Inside this book, you'll find:

A dozen alien creatures from throughout Golarion's solar system.
Player-race information to let you be the alien, from the atrophied psychic creatures called contemplatives to the bug-like haan who float across gas giants on balloons of spun webbing.
Instructions for easily converting Starfinder creatures into Pathfinder foes.
Sneak previews of some of the new abilities and rules systems featured in Starfinder.
Take your Pathfinder campaign to the stars with this official manual of Starfinder aliens!




This special 16-page rulebook was created for Free RPG Day on June 17, 2017. The print edition will be available for sale and a free download will be available Summer 2017.

What's more, the set also contains more than a dozen different starship pawn designs for use with Starfinder's starship combat system! 225251.name: Starfinder Adventure Path Dead Suns 1: Incident at Absalom Station

From publisher blurb:The Dead Suns Adventure Path kicks off with "Incident at Absalom Station," the inaugural adventure for the Starfinder Roleplaying Game. A deserted mining ship emerges from hyperspace at Absalom Station, towing a mysterious asteroid behind it. After battling warring factions on the station, the heroes are recruited to explore the ship and asteroid and discover the fate of the ship's missing crew, only to learn that the asteroid is a fragment of a larger, ancient structure—an alien weapon that could threaten the safety and security of all of the Pact Worlds, should it fall into the wrong hands.

"Incident at Absalom Station" is a Starfinder Roleplaying Game adventure for 1st-level characters. This volume of the Starfinder Adventure Path features a gazetteer of Absalom Station, the orbital habitat that serves as humanity's home in the Pact Worlds, and a selection of new monsters from a variety of alien worlds.

225252.name: Dancing With the Clans
225252.description:
From the introduction:

It’s a dry spell for the vampires in Deep Jutland; there’s too little to chew on and too many old farts. It has thus caused quite a stir that Easter will bring a flooding of young, fresh blood. Ok, geeks, but beggars can’t be choosers.

In order to avoid outright clan wars for the temporary territory, a group of three archons has been sent to administer the situation. The group is led by Praetor Raven. So as not to have too large breaches in the Masquerade, it has been decided that any disputes shall be settled with as little bloodshed as possible. And, in order to truly blend in amongst humans, a concept from telly has been adapted.

Dancing contest!
